pullRequest.body:
- add `finsuppTensorFinsuppLid`, `finsuppTensorFinsuppRid` as well as their simp lemmas
- make `finsuppTensorFinsupp'` a special case of `finsuppTensorFinsuppLid`
- add `TensorProduct.lid_eq_rid`

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Related: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Linearly.20disjoint/near/411691388

does not depend on: #10824 #11635 [probably?]

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8465874787/job/23193444871)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8465874787/job/23193444512)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8465874787/job/23193444099)
Does this import create a loop? If not I think it's appropriate to add it.

In fact I doubt the usefulness of this result, in particular as a simp lemma: suppose it was `Finsupp.single i r * Finsupp.single i (s * t)`, then probably `simp` will expand the second `Finsupp.single` and skip this result.

Perhaps we should remove `finsuppTensorFinsupp'_symm_single_mul_single` in favor of `finsuppTensorFinsupp'_symm_single` and asks user to manually `rw` to desired form.
I removed this, but added two more results which I need to use later. What's your opinion?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/DirectSum/Finsupp): add some more variants of `finsuppTensorFinsupp`
